intro: Eremogone congesta var. wheelerensis, commonly known as the Wheeler's clustered eremogone, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
